lead.en: A Data Visualization Designer and Researcher.

about.en:
I am a Data Visualization Specialist at Microsoft in Redmond, where I research and design information visualizations to extract and communicate data-driven insights. I am also a lecturer at UCBerkeley Information School, where I teach Information Visualization and Communication course as part of the Data Science program.

During my PhD at the University of Manitoba in Canada, I worked as a research assistant in the Human-Computer Interaction Lab under the supervision of Dr. Pourang Irani. I designed and conducted quantitative and qualitative research on information visualization tools and techniques for data storytelling to broad audiences.

I have had the chance to work with several great researchers around the world and have completed research internships at Tableau Inc. working with Dr. Robert Kosara in 2017, and Microsoft Research working with Dr. Nathalie Hery Riche in 2016. Prior to starting my PhD I worked at IDERS Inc. (GE Transportation), where I worked as a user interface developer and in a team lead position for more than 4 years.
